DOC.brief_summary: People who do not have adequate amounts of vitamin D develop weakness of leg and arm muscles. This study will determine if vitamin D supplementation benefits muscle functions important for swallowing, bladder and bowel function.
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation of Potential Vitamin D Effects on Muscle: a Pilot Study
DOC.criteria: Patients who present for evaluation to the UW Geriatric clinic including Dr. Pryzbelski's subspecialty, or Osteoporosis clinics Age 70 years or older Cognitively intact, as determined by the attending physicians at above mentioned clinics History of, on ongoing, renal failure History of liver failure Known malabsorption Known disorders of parathyroid function, hyper/hypocalcemia, or other abnormalities of calcium or phosphate metabolism Known history of vitamin D intoxication or granulomatous disease active seizure disorder Pain associated with temporomandibular joint (TMJ)
